item.title: 随着股市反弹，Michael Burry 押注中国大型科技公司
item.description: 随着中国股市触底反弹，Michael Burry 的投资公司在第一季度加倍押注于 JD.com Inc 和 Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. 。【原文：Michael Burry’s investment firm doubled down on its bets on JD.com Inc and Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. in the first quarter as Chinese equities bottomed out.】

item.title: 红海中断将全球液化天然气贸易分割成不同区域
item.description: 自从一艘液化天然气油轮通过分隔阿拉伯半岛和非洲的狭窄海峡以来，已经过去四个月了。【原文：It’s been four months since a liquefied natural gas tanker has passed through the narrow strait separating the Arabian Peninsula and Africa, testament to how violent attacks there have upended global energy trade.】

item.title: 印度大选中值得关注的关键选区
item.description: 印度大选已经过半，各主要政党之间的竞选活动也像全国各地飙升的气温一样不断升温。【原文：India’s election is past the halfway mark, with campaigning between the main political parties heating up just like the soaring temperatures across the country.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金在资产管理费问题上玩硬的
item.description: 澳大利亚蓬勃发展的 3.7 万亿澳元（约合 2.5 万亿美元）养老金行业在资产管理费问题上表现出了强硬的谈判姿态，因为数据显示这些基金支付的费用往往比其他基金低很多。【原文：Australia’s booming A$3.7 trillion ($2.5 trillion) pensions industry is proving a tough negotiator on asset management fees, as data reveals the funds often pay significantly less than others.】

item.title: 中国房地产股因购房建议而大涨
item.description: 中国开发商的股价跳涨，原因是他们乐观地认为，中国政府将提供政策支持，购买不良建筑商未售出的房屋。【原文：The shares of Chinese developers jumped on optimism that Beijing will provide policy support for the purchase of unsold homes from distressed builders.】

item.title: 中国垃圾美元债券价格升至 2021 年以来最高点
item.description: 在政府努力支撑受重创的房地产行业之际，中国的垃圾美元债券涨至三年来的最高水平。【原文：China’s junk dollar bonds are rallying to their highest level in three years amid government efforts to shore up the bruised property sector.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司员工获得近八个月工资的奖金
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，新加坡航空公司（Singapore Airlines Ltd.）在连续第二年实现创纪录的年度利润后，将向员工发放价值近八个月工资的奖金。【原文：Singapore Airlines Ltd. will reward staff with a bonus payout worth almost eight months of salary, according to a person familiar with the matter, after delivering a second consecutive record annual profit.】

item.title: 银行称对冲基金做空澳元的押注有可能适得其反
item.description: 对冲基金毫不怀疑澳元将走低。澳大利亚最大的银行却不敢苟同。【原文：Hedge funds have little doubt that the Australian dollar is headed lower. The nation’s biggest banks beg to differ.】

item.title: 德莱弗斯竞购 Namoi 引发澳大利亚竞争担忧
item.description: 澳大利亚监管机构担心，路易达孚公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.【原文：Australia’s regulator raised concerns that Louis Dreyfus Co.’s proposed takeover of Namoi Cotton Ltd. will likely reduce competition for processing services for some of the nation’s growers.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司盈利创纪录，员工将获得近 8 个月的奖金：新加坡航空公司
item.description: 据《海峡时报》援引新加坡航空公司首席执行官吴俊峰（Goh Choon Phong）的公告报道，包括飞行员在内的新加坡航空公司员工可能会获得 7.94 个月的利润分享奖金。【原文：Singapore Airlines Ltd. staff, including pilots, may get a profit-sharing bonus of 7.94 months, the Straits Times reported, citing an announcement it had seen from chief executive officer Goh Choon Phong.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。S&P 500指数创下今年第23项纪录。波音公司有四周时间说服美国不要起诉。中国的美国国债库存降至 2009 年以来最低。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. S&P 500 notches 23rd record this year. Boeing has four weeks to convince the US not to prosecute. China’s stockpile of US Treasuries slides to lowest since 2009. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 石油因美国库存下降和更广泛的风险情绪而走高
item.description: 受美国库存缩减和美国通胀退潮迹象引发的更广泛风险情绪的提振，石油连续第二天上涨。【原文：Oil rose for a second day, buoyed by shrinking US stockpiles and a wider risk-on mood triggered by signs of ebbing US inflation.】

item.title: 一船石油的奇特之旅凸显全球市场的波动
item.description: 重质原油的匮乏迫使世界上最大的买家之一不得不采取额外措施来获得所需的桶装原油，这再次说明制裁和欧佩克+的限制措施正在重塑供应链。【原文：A dearth of heavy crude is forcing one of the world’s biggest buyers to go the extra mile to get the barrels it needs, offering another example of how sanctions and OPEC+ curbs are recasting the supply chain.】

item.title: 美国 CPI 下降后亚洲将延续风险反弹：市场综述
item.description: 周四，美国股市和债券因通胀数据放缓而攀升，为美联储降息提供了空间，亚洲股市将随之反弹。【原文：Equities in Asia were set to rally Thursday after US stocks and bonds climbed on slowing inflation data, providing room for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 劳伦森银行退出证券研究部门，裁员约 50 人
item.description: 加拿大劳伦森银行（Laurentian Bank of Canada）正在裁减更多的工作岗位，以全面调整其战略，其中包括退出股票研究业务。【原文：Laurentian Bank of Canada is cutting more jobs in an overhaul of its strategy that includes exiting the equity research business.】

item.title: Peloton 借助摩根大通出售 8.5 亿美元贷款解决债务问题
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Peloton Interactive Inc. 已聘请摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Peloton Interactive Inc. has hired JPMorgan Chase & Co. to raise around $850 million through a new loan sale that will refinance existing debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 混合动力车为丰田和本田的电动车雄心提供现金储备
item.description: 1997 年，丰田汽车公司推出了世界上第一辆汽油-电动混合动力汽车，当时每卖出一辆普锐斯都会亏损。几十年后的今天，混合动力汽车的热销为丰田带来了可观的现金流。【原文：When Toyota Motor Corp. introduced the world’s first hybrid gasoline-electric vehicle in 1997, it made a loss on every Prius it sold. Decades later, booming sales in the category are delivering a much welcome cash boost.】

item.title: 疯狂的韩国加密货币交易为比特币创纪录奠定基础
item.description: 早在全球加密货币热潮推动价格在 2024 年初创下历史新高之前，韩国散户投资者就开始大量涌入本地数字资产交易所。【原文：South Korean retail investors were piling into local digital-asset exchanges in greater numbers well ahead of the global crypto boom that drove prices to record highs in early 2024.】

item.title: 马拉松公司首席执行官理查兹说，马拉松公司正在利用 AMC 的备忘录股票反弹进行套现
item.description: 马拉松资产管理公司（Marathon Asset Management）首席执行官布鲁斯-理查兹（Bruce Richards）周三在彭博电视上表示，马拉松资产管理公司在 AMC 娱乐控股公司（AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc.【原文：Marathon Asset Management bought AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. debt when it traded at a deep discount and the cinema chain’s latest meme-stock rally has only made those holdings more attractive, Chief Executive Officer Bruce Richards said on Bloomberg Television Wednesday.】

item.title: 全球市场都感受到纽约铜市的空头压力
item.description: 纽约铜价与其他商品交易所铜价之间的巨大差距震撼了全球金属市场，并促使人们疯狂抢购运往美国的铜。【原文：A massive dislocation between the prices for copper traded in New York and other commodity exchanges has rocked the global market for the metal and prompted a frantic dash for supplies to ship to the US.】

item.title: 自称 "加密货币之王 "却损失 3,000 万美元的人在加拿大被起诉
item.description: 自称 "加密货币之王 "的艾登-普莱特斯基（Aiden Pleterski）从投资者那里收集了数百万美元，却把钱花在了奢侈品上，他因诈骗罪在加拿大被捕。【原文：Aiden Pleterski, the self-proclaimed “Crypto King” who collected millions of dollars from investors, only to spend it on luxury goods, has been arrested on fraud charges in Canada.】

item.title: Red Lobster 债权人将权衡破产保护中的资产出价
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，Red Lobster Management LLC 的一组贷款人正在考虑通过潜在的破产保护出售程序竞购资产，并夺取这家海鲜连锁餐厅的控制权。【原文：A group of lenders to Red Lobster Management LLC is considering bidding for assets through a potential Chapter 11 sale process and seizing control of the seafood restaurant chain, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金削减所报告的美国股票持有量
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金在第一季度末削减了其报告持有的美国股票数量，将其直接持有的美国股票数量减半。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund slashed the number of US stocks it reported owning at the end of the first quarter, roughly halving its direct holdings in those equities.】

item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔公司披露持有保险公司 Chubb 67 亿美元股份
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. unveiled a $6.7 billion stake in insurer Chubb Ltd., ending months of suspense over its mystery position in a financial firm, previously kept concealed in regulatory filings.】

item.title: Blackstone 寻求以折扣价出售 4.5 亿美元信贷
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 的信贷部门正寻求出售约 4.5 亿美元的贷款，其中一些是不良贷款，目的是为老基金的投资者提供流动性。【原文：Blackstone Inc.’s credit unit is looking to sell about $450 million of loans, some of which are distressed, as it aims to provide liquidity to investors in an older fund, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 大宗商品创一年来新高，带来新的通胀威胁
item.description: 衡量原材料价格的一个关键指标升至一年多来的最高水平，使各国央行抑制通胀的努力受到影响。【原文：A key gauge for raw materials prices rose to the highest level in more than a year, throwing a wrench in central banks’ efforts to tamp down inflation.】

item.title: 加州大学因抵制以色列学术活动而引起反弹
item.description: 加州公立文理学院索诺玛州立大学（Sonoma State University）因与支持巴勒斯坦的抗议者达成一项协议而受到批评，该协议包括对以色列的学术抵制以及学生活动分子在执行协议中的作用。【原文：Sonoma State University, a public liberal arts college in California, is facing criticism for an agreement with pro-Palestinian protesters that includes an academic boycott of Israel and a role for student activists to enforce the deal.】

item.title: Citadel 证券公司第一季度收入达 23 亿美元
item.description: Citadel Securities 在 2024 年的前三个月创造了 23 亿美元的净交易收入，随着其在新资产类别和地区的扩张，这家做市商公司有望在今年创下历史新高。【原文：Citadel Securities generated $2.3 billion of net trading revenue in the first three months of 2024, setting the market-making firm up for a potentially record year as it expands in new assets classes and geographies.】

item.title: 伦纳德-格林希望为首支二级基金投资 15 亿美元
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，Leonard Green & Partners 正在为其普通合伙人领导的首支二级基金设定 15 亿美元的目标。【原文：Leonard Green & Partners is targeting $1.5 billion for its debut general partner-led secondaries fund, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: GameStop 的套现窗口即将关闭
item.description: GameStop 公司连续两周的飙升使其股价上涨了两倍多，但该公司本身并没有利用股价上涨的机会抛售股票，原因众说纷纭。【原文：A raucous two-week stretch for GameStop Corp. has more than tripled its share price, but the company itself hasn’t taken advantage of the surge by selling stock — and the explanations about why are wide-ranging.】
